VLIB_packMask32

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_packMask32 (const uint8_t *restrict maskImage, uint32_t *restrict mask32packed, const uint32_t pixelCount)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_packMask32 ( const uint8_t *restrict  maskImage,
uint32_t *restrict  mask32packed,
const uint32_t  pixelCount 
)

Description:
This function packs 8-bit unpacked data to a 32-bit packed binary format (each 32 bytes of input converts to 32 bits of output).
Parameters:
[in] maskImage Unpacked binary mask image buffer (UQ8.0)
[out] mask32packed 32-bit packed binary mask buffer (32-bit packed)
[in] pixelCount Number of pixels to process (UQ32.0)
Assumptions:
  • I/O buffers are assumed to be double-word aligned and not aliased.
  • The pixelCount must be a multiple of 8.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is fully interruptible
  • This code is compatible with C64X+ fixed-point processors
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
